p: To investigate the effects of herbivory and competition on the growth of Mikania in more detail, we calculated four response indices for the above-ground biomass of Mikania: defoliation responses (DR = with defoliation/without defoliation) and competition responses (CR = with competition/without competition [10]. This calculation is based on a null model that competition and herbivory do not interact and respond multiplicatively on a linear scale. If DR or CR = 1, there would be no effect of competition or herbivory on plant growth. If DR or CR <1, there would be a negative effect; If DR or CR>1, there would be a positive effect. We also calculated TR pred (DR × CR) to indicate the simple multiplicative effects of competition and herbivory together on plant growth and TR true (with defoliation and competition/without defoliation and competition) to indicate the observed combined effect of both competition and herbivory [10]. If TR pred > TR true, there would be a synergistic interaction between competition and herbivory; If TR pred < TR true, there would be an antagonistic interaction. If TR pred = TR true, there would be no interaction.
